qas.question: What are the origins of the word madrasa?
What type of educational institution does the term madrasa refer?
In Western culture, the term madrasa widely refers to the practices of what religion?
How many students enrolled in madaris are Muslim?
What does Madrasa mean in French?
What type of educational institution does the term madrasa not cover?
In Eastern culture, what religion does the term Madrasa refer to?
What school does Madrasa not refer to?
What is studied in Islamic religions?

context: <b8_0>Madrasa<b8_0/> (Arabic: مدرسة‎, madrasah, pl. مدارس, madāris, Turkish: <b4_0>Medrese<b4_0/>) is the <a0_0>Arabic<a0_0/> word for <a1_0><b5_0>any type<b5_0/><a1_0/> of educational institution, whether secular or religious (of any religion). The word is variously transliterated madrasah, madarasaa, medresa, madrassa, madraza, medrese, etc. In the West, the word usually refers to a specific type of <b7_0>religious school<b7_0/> or college for the study of the <a2_0><b6_0>Islamic<b6_0/><a2_0/> religion, though this may not be the only subject studied. <a3_0>Not all<a3_0/> students in madaris are Muslims; there is also a modern curriculum.
